snippet: A dispute between two obscure mining companies demonstrates why the World Trade Organization needs the power to look into anticompetitive partnerships.
abstract: Editorial analyzes complex dispute between two obscure Russian mining companies that lays bare price fixing in potash, important fertilizer needed by farmers around the world; holds potash cartels have imposed billions of dollars in extra costs on farmers and consumers worldwide; says  issue illustrates why World Trade Organization needs the power to investigate and punish such behavior.
lead_paragraph: A dispute between two obscure mining companies demonstrates why the World Trade Organization needs the power to look into anticompetitive partnerships.
